content.description:
From below the arete that

forms

the left margin of the face, scramble onto the boulder leaning against the wall and clip a bolt. Use a side pull and features to gain a stance in a shallow hueco.

Continue

up the face wandering left and right following the line of least resistance. After the 4th bolt, move left onto the arÃªte and climb to the anchor.
content.location: Scramble onto boulders on the extreme left side of the face that is Southern Arizona.

content.description:
From the left side of the face scramble onto a large disc shaped boulder and then onto a horizontal shelf. Clip the 1st bolt and climb the large unique knobs. C

ontinue

up the sculpted groove on features. Climb the upper face on small edges and features to the anchor.
content.location: Begin twenty feet from the left edge of the Southern Arizona face at a large four foot diameter disc shaped boulder, below a the large knobs and a unique groove.

content.description:
From the right side of the face, below a series of very

large

, unique knobs pull onto a shelf, above a horizontal crack. Move left, between the knobs, and climb through a large

depression

as the face steepens.

Continue

climbing the wonderfully plated face on patina plates and features to an anchor with chains.
content.location: Right side of the Southern Arizona face below large unique knobs.
